meanings.sent1: The dark clouds presignified the coming storm.
meanings.sent2: She presignified her intentions by leaving early.
meanings.sent3: The chirping birds presignified a joyful morning ahead.
meanings.sent4: The sudden drop in temperature presignified the arrival of winter.
meanings.sent5: His frown presignified his displeasure with the situation.

meanings.definition: To give a sign or indication before something happens
meanings.sent1: The old clock presignified the hour with its chime.
meanings.sent2: The teacher presignified the end of class by closing her book.
meanings.sent3: The barking dog presignified the arrival of the mailman.
meanings.sent4: The distant thunder presignified the approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The red sky at night presignified a beautiful day tomorrow.
